title: Silicon Valley’s Man in the White House Is Benefiting Himself and His Friends
summary: David Sacks, the Trump administration’s A.I. and crypto czar, has helped formulate policies that aid his Silicon Valley friends and many of his own tech investments.

title: Trump Frees Fraudster Just Days Into Seven-Year Prison Sentence
summary: David Gentile had been found guilty for his role in what prosecutors described as a $1.6 billion scheme that defrauded thousands of investors.

title: The Ex-President Whom Trump Plans to Pardon Flooded America With Cocaine
summary: Juan Orlando Hernández, whom Mr. Trump called a victim of persecution, helped orchestrate a decades-long trafficking conspiracy. It ravaged his Central American country.

title: In Announcing Pardon of Drug Trafficker While Threatening Venezuela, Trump Displays Contradictions
summary: President Trump’s statements on social media less than 24 hours apart showed the dissonance in his campaign against drug trafficking.

title: What to Know About Honduras’s Elections
summary: President Trump has put a spotlight on Honduras as voters head to the polls. Their choices include the left-wing party in power and a candidate endorsed by Mr. Trump.

title: The Political Price Shock of Data Centers and Electric Bills
summary: Democrats zeroed in on utilities and affordability to win Republican support in upset elections in Georgia and Virginia. Can the same playbook work in 2026?

title: Netanyahu Asks Israel’s President to Pardon Him in Corruption Cases
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made the contentious appeal weeks after President Trump had made the same request to the Israeli president.

title: The Netanyahu Corruption Trial, Explained
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asked Israel’s president to pardon him preemptively, before any verdicts were reached in his corruption cases. Here’s what to know about his trial.

title: Pope Leo Calls for a Two-State Solution in Mideast Conflict
summary: The pope, en route to Lebanon after visiting Turkey, said he had discussed with the Turkish president how the Vatican might help Israel and the Palestinian territories find peace.

title: The Shocking Crash That Led Marin County to Reckon With the Dangers of E-Bikes
summary: Unregulated e-bikes are a growing danger on American streets. In one Bay Area town, a terrible accident finally led to reform.

title: The Language of Tom Stoppard, Ablaze With Energy and Urgency
summary: In works like “Travesties” and “Arcadia,” the playwright embraced the really big questions and wrestled words into coherent, exhilarating shape.

title: When Tom Stoppard Confronted His Background in His Final Play ‘Leopoldstadt’
summary: The playwright, who learned about his Jewish heritage late in life, addressed it in the Tony Award-winning drama “Leopoldstadt.”

title: Glenn Close, Ethan Hawke and Others Mourn Tom Stoppard
summary: Nobody advanced or cherished the English language more than Stoppard, Tim Curry noted. Colleagues and fans agreed.

title: America Has Sidelined Education. You Can Help.
summary: The New York Times Communities Fund has partnered with charities that invest in education at critical junctures across people’s life spans.

title: It’s OK That Our Long, Mostly Good Marriage Ended
summary: Four years ago, my husband and I made an increasingly common choice: We hugged, apologized for our shortcomings and freed each other.

title: The Dangers of E-bikes
summary: Injuries and deaths are rising — but the law hasn’t kept up.

title: Mamdani, a Sharp Critic of Police Surveillance, Will Soon Oversee It
summary: Zohran Mamdani, New York’s mayor-elect, has criticized the N.Y.P.D.’s surveillance tactics. He reappointed the police commissioner who helped create a ubiquitous web of monitoring.

title: Deadly Floods in Indonesia Leave Hundreds Missing
summary: Hundreds of people have been killed and millions displaced as extreme weather has ravaged Southeast Asia this month. Indonesia’s heavy rain was linked to two tropical cyclones.

title: Fed Up With the Taliban, Pakistan Expels Masses of Afghans
summary: Labeling Afghans a national security threat, Pakistan has forced out about a million this year, depriving them of a haven from Afghanistan’s turmoil.

title: Cory Booker Weds Alexis Lewis in a Private Ceremony
summary: The couple married at a courthouse in Newark days before hosting an intimate wedding in Washington, D.C. on Saturday. They shared their wedding details exclusively with The New York Times.
